title: What is the meaning of 'Wither' by Dream Theater? - Quora

response.answer_text: ‘Enlightenment’ or to be more accurate, the feeling of giving up one’s ego and all the problems it has created: The chorus “So I wither, And render myself helpless, I give in and everything is clear” is very Buddhist in nature, not trying to gain something, but losing all ‘hang-ups’ and seeing the world clearly, without the usual backdrop of dread. The Middle 8th lyrics would make Alan Watts smile: “I drown in hesitation, My words come crashing down, All my best creations are burning to the ground.” The band also made good chord decisions. The darker verses are musically interesting using Bbm-Fm as the setup. The chorus is done in standard 4-chord pop format - the right thing to do for inspirational themes. The choice of C# is much ‘darker’ than the pure C. It's a song about John Petrucci's experience with writer's block. He “withers” when he struggles to come up with ideas he thinks are worthy to be expanded.
